subclusters.subcluster_name: ROS and Chronic Inflammation-Driven Immunological Aging

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on the dual role of inflammation, especially chronic inflammation's contribution to aging pathology and fibrosis, fitting the chronic inflammation mechanistic theme.
Links systemic low-grade inflammation and altered insulin/IGF signaling to aging and age-related diseases, emphasizing chronic inflammation as a key driver.
Describes immunosenescence and inflammaging driven by IL-23 signaling, highlighting chronic inflammation's role in systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS and Chronic Inflammation-Driven Immunological Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates ROS-induced oxidative stress with chronic inflammation and immune senescence, emphasizing inflammation as a central aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS and Chronic Inflammation-Driven Immunological Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on inflammation and oxidative stress driving microvascular aging, linking ROS and chronic inflammation to vascular aging.
Centers on exosomes modulating inflammaging and immune communication, representing a distinct mechanism of immune aging via extracellular vesicles.
Focuses on deterioration of adaptive immunity, impaired immunosurveillance, and pro-inflammatory lymphocyte phenotypes driving aging.
Links immunological aging to brain aging via immune system decline, emphasizing adaptive immune system's role in brain maintenance.
Describes immune senescence driven by chronic immune activation and CTLA-4 upregulation, focusing on T cell regulatory changes.
Attributes immunosenescence primarily to thymic microenvironment degeneration affecting T cell development.
Discusses immunosenescence and inflammaging as co-evolving immune aging mechanisms, emphasizing immune system decline.
Focuses on age-related decline in T lymphocyte signal transduction as a driver of immune and systemic aging.
Centers on autoimmune responses increasing with age, contributing to tissue damage and systemic aging.
Highlights chronic inflammation as a hallmark of aging, particularly in ovarian aging, fitting the chronic inflammation theme.
Details T cell dysfunction and multiple factors contributing to immunosenescence, emphasizing adaptive immune decline.
Focuses on NLRP3 inflammasome activation driving inflammaging and sarcopenia, a specific inflammatory immune mechanism.
Links age-related zinc deficiency to impaired immune function and inflammaging, highlighting nutrient-immune interactions.
Posits chronic low-grade inflammation as a causal driver of aging and age-related diseases, fitting the chronic inflammation cluster.
Describes hematopoietic stem cell decline and immune alterations leading to chronic inflammation and systemic aging.
Focuses on NF-kappa B dysregulation impairing immune senescence, emphasizing transcriptional regulation in adaptive immunity.
Proposes a proinflammatory status as a driver of aging, linking inflammation to vascular injury and systemic aging.
Links thymic involution, immune decline, and increased autoantibody production to aging and mortality.
Describes chronic inflammation as a mechanism of aging-related functional decline, emphasizing inflammation biomarkers.
Focuses on IL-6 mediated neuroinflammation driving brain aging and cognitive decline, a brain-specific immune aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Premature Immunosenescence from Early-Life Immune Challenges
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes premature immunological aging caused by recurrent childhood infections and immune dysregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune Response to Somatic Mutation-Generated Neo-Antigens
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on immune recognition of somatic mutation-generated neo-antigens causing tissue damage and aging.
